summary: As the trio prepares to go through the trapdoor, Hermione double-checks their plan, clearly anxious but determined. She insists on bringing logic and structure to the chaos, packing supplies and reinforcing the rationale behind their decision. Her practicality helps steady the group. She’s scared, but her commitment to stopping wrongdoing outweighs her fear—showcasing how her bravery now includes decisive action.
logline: Hermione’s preparation grounds the group, proving that courage can be careful and calculated.
speech_style: Calm but firm; thinks aloud in organized, rational steps
